description: From Old French edifier (“to build, to edify”), from Latin aedificare (“build”).

verbs.description: edify (third-person singular simple present edifies, present participle edifying, simple past and past participle edified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To instruct or improve morally or intellectually.
examples: It does not appear probable that our dispute [about miracles] would either edify or enlighten the public.
